body.name: HPRT Portable Printers Wireless for Travel - MT810 Bluetooth Thermal Inkless Compact Printer, Paper Rolls Mobile Printing for Vehicles Office, Compatible with iPhone Android & Laptop
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 23 hrs 12 mins
features: Portable Wireless Printers: This printer has a small size of 10.6"X3.74"X1.97", making it lightweight and portable. It can be held with one hand and fits easily in your backpack, briefcase—allowing for convenient mobile printing anywhere, whether it be for business, travel, car, office or school.

Thermal Printing: The HPRT 810 Thermal Printer uses thermal print technology, which means that it is inkless and does not require carbon or ribbon. It is compatible with A4 thermal paper rolls with 3 special coated layers that provides high quality printing.NOTE:【This portable printer only supports black and white printing】.

Easy to Use: The HPRT MT810 mobile printer adopts 5.0 Bluetooth technology and has a Type-C interface, making it easy to connect quickly and easily to iOS and Android mobile phones. It can also be connected via USB to laptops and desktop PCs. The "HerePrint" App can be downloaded when the mobile phone is connected, and the rich APP functions will help you get a richer printing experience.

Designs of HPRT MT810: The continuous paper roll (=24 A4-sized lengths) inside the printer eliminates the inconvenience caused by paper carrying. You can choose the length of printing according to your needs. The printer provides a sawtooth tearer to help you tear off the printed paper and keep it flat and neat.

Comprehensive Customer Service: If you encounter any problems that you cannot solve from the detail page or user manual, please email us and we will reply within 24 hours. Please be careful to avoid scratches when changing paper rolls and using the printer. Keep the printer out of the reach of children.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Traveler's Best Friend for On-the-Go Printing
reviews.reviewText: I recently added the HPRT Portable Printer MT810 to my travel gear and it has been a game-changer. Here's my take on its pros and cons:Pros:1. Truly Portable: This printer is compact and lightweight, making it incredibly easy to pack into a backpack or carry-on.2. Wireless Convenience: The Bluetooth functionality allows for quick and hassle-free printing directly from my iPhone, Android, and laptop.3. Inkless Printing: The thermal inkless technology is not only environmentally friendly but also eliminates the need to carry around ink cartridges or toners, making it even more travel-friendly.4. Quick Setup: It was pretty straightforward to set up. The manual is clear, and I was up and running in no time.5. Versatile: I’ve used it for printing out invoices, tickets, and even quick snapshots while on the road. It’s proven to be extremely versatile.6. Good Battery Life: I was pleasantly surprised by how long the battery lasts. It's sufficient for multiple printing sessions without needing a recharge.7. Quality Output: The print quality is quite good for a portable printer, especially for text and simple graphics.Cons:1. Paper Size Limitations: The paper roll sizes are smaller than standard paper, so it’s not ideal for larger documents.2. Price of Paper Rolls: While the printer itself is cost-effective, the specialized paper rolls can be a bit pricey.3. Monochrome Only: It only prints in black and white, which is fine for most of my needs but may not be suitable for those requiring color prints.In my opinion, the HPRT Portable Printer MT810 is an excellent investment for anyone who frequently travels for business or leisure and needs the ability to print on the go. Its ease of use, compact size, and inkless technology make it incredibly convenient, and the quality is more than satisfactory for most tasks. Although it has some limitations like paper size and monochrome printing, these are minor trade-offs for the portability and convenience it offers. Highly recommended for the modern traveler.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome little printer
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. It’s my first day, but so far I love this thing. I’m an independent field tech who gets work from a platform. This means as work orders are posted or routed to me, I either request or accept the work. There are many different companies that assign me work and they all require different paperwork. They also require me to print a badge for each work order.This thing is handy because not only do I sometimes forget to grab pre-printed work orders and badges, but sometimes I get assigned a work order while I’m already in the field and have no way of printing out the necessary documents. This printer gives me the ability to be ready for any paperwork regardless of the situation.Right out of the box it was already at 89% battery charge, so if needed it was ready for me. It comes with a simple but informative instructional booklet with a QR code for the app of using on the mobile device. While the instructions didn’t specify how to put the printer in pairing mode (BT), it wasn’t hard for me to figure it out, as most devices use the same process.Once the app was downloaded and the printer was paired, test printing was a breeze. As many have mentioned, the print quality is compatible to a fax machine, but in my personal opinion, it is a higher quality than any fax machine we had in the house when I was growing up. Regardless of opinion, it works perfect for printing the documents I need for work. It is dark and very legible, and the paper is definitely thicker than the fax paper I’ve seen in the past.So far I’ve only seen two down sides to using this printer: I sometimes get an error about parsing the document when I try to open a document from the app. More importantly, I can’t print a document directly from its source, such as my work portal or website. I have to save the document to a folder on my phone, open the print app, and then search for the document. While it’s not terrible, it’s a little inconvenient. I don’t know if the issue is with the app or with the iOS, because the printer doesn’t show up in the list of available printers when trying to print from source. If that changes I think I won’t have any issues, but again, it’s too early to tell.Lastly, there is a travel/storage case available for the printer. I’ve made a separate review for that, so I won’t repeat it here. But I do recommend getting it. I believe I paid $15 for it.Hopefully this review helps you decide, if you’re on the fence about it. There may be printers out there with more convenient features or better quality -idk, but if like me, you’re on a budget and just need something simple for quick prints or on the go stuff, I highly recommend this product.One last thing - for the manufacturers: I work with cables all the time and have to seldomly print labels. My label maker kind of sucks and I see that there are wrap-around label paper for printers. The issue is they’re mostly for laser printers and some inkjet. For my work, I don’t always know the specific label titles that are required until after I arrive. If someone could develop these wrap-around style label paper for this type of thermal printer, that would be amazing. Just putting it out there.
